oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |han=kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Moon is not to be laughed at. By /han=kasso (L VIII--28. 8441-8443, 8446). People say that the Moon becomes angry when they laugh at it. People thus call it |kuan ttu to show it respect to try and keep it from going into the sky. The Moon's wife is ||ko'on. 1) p.8440: |han=kass'o heard this from his mother (|xabbi-an), 2) p.8441v: the Moon's other name and the name of the Moon's wife, 3) See also The Moon seeking his wife, ||ko'on, 4) This story is found in Book VIII-28.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Moon not to be laughed at
